pageContent: Background: The central role of prostate-specific antigen (PSA) testing in the diagnosis of prostate cancer leads to the possibility that observational studies that report associations between risk factors and prostate cancer could be affected by detection bias. This study aims to investigate whether reported risk factors for prostate cancer are associated with PSA testing in a large middle-aged population-based cohort in the UK.

metaData.source:
Long-term costs and survival of prostate cancer: a population-based study
https://pubmed.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/28762117/
